author: konmaorg
title: KonmaDAO - A DAO of DAOs
description: While Cardano provides a great space for hosting DAOs, community members and new entrants are unaware of the Cardano ecosystem, dev support, tools & resources etc.

f6_assessments.q0: It is an interesting proposal to have DAO among DAOs. The proposal does address the challenge on creating collaboration management platform for DAOs. It will be more transparent if the team include who are the 10 sub DAOs under them stated in their proposal. The team wants to bridge DAOs using tools for newcomers to the DAO and the details of such tools is not well defined. There is insufficient information on what the tools going to be built and how it will help the Cardano ecosystem. It will be beneficial for the team to give few examples of the bridge tools and how it will influence the Cardano community. The risks mentioned in this proposal is not enough funding. However, the main risk that I see is security for this DAO and trust among other DAO projects to use this as a collaboration platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The team gave a decent timeline of 6 months for their project. The team seem to have the necessary experience to run this project. However, none of the team seem to have knowledge about Haskell programming language based on their LinkedIn profiles. Security is important in the entire crypto space and having a team with knowledge with Haskell is beneficial for the Cardano and crypto ecosystem. In addition, if the team includes having tests and third party auditing their code creates trust for the Cardano community to use their platform. The breakdown of the budget is quite brief. It will be beneficial for the voters know where the funds go to. If the team breakdowns who and how many people will be working on the designing, development, no. of hours per week per worker, how the treasury is going to be used, etc., then there will be better understanding for the voters how the fund is distributed among the team and the DAO.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditing is quite sensible by on boarding the number of DAOs to their platform. The team have a target to on-board 2 DAOs per month and subsequent 5 DAOs periodically. The community can monitor by the announcements provided by the team in 6 months (as mentioned in their proposal) if this proposal is funded. It will be more transparent if the team updates their on-boarding progress or having announcements or AMAs once or twice a month to keep the community updated. Besides that, the DAOs they on-board must have a certain criterion in their list so that the DAOs are quality ones and not scammer types. Another suggestion is to have a github for the community to check any templates produced if the team is serious on building this tool for the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.reply:
- Each department of Konma is an autonomous entity solely responsible for its own tasks and goals, as mentioned in the proposal, these (inhouse) entities will be the SubDAOs, this will also include external DAOs that wish to be a part of Konma and not just exist as an isolated DAO (for which we will also provide assistance). another assessment literally rated us high for this very point 
- Our team includes students from Chennai Mathematical Institute who learn Haskell as part of their undergraduate, a Plutus pioneer pass out from IOG, and an in-house Haskell expert (Santhanu) who has around 10+ years of experience in developing industry-level applications with Haskell, this team is then supported by members of the Cardano Defi alliance and the developer community, this also includes some of the major organizations within Cardano to assist and guide
- As we are purely a community-driven entity, we welcome anyone and everyone to Konma united through our socials to join in for our weekly AMA, where each department (SubDAO) provides updates of the week, this includes updates for catalyst funds, programs currently running and general updates, this is also then made as a recording and available on our platform (Konmahood)

f6_assessments.q0:
This ambitious proposal seeks to create the technical infrastructure for social life. This project is aiming to create one of the larger Knives on the Cardano Blockchain. Konma is a decentralized autonomous organization that manages the various factions of koma and other partnerships. They plan to make every faction of Konma a sub-DAO under the main Konma DAO. The ambition and intensity of this project are huge and could pave the way for mass adoption in the fields of activity, pushing forward the Cardano Blockchain. All of this will start with the successful implementation of this DAO. Therefore, it must be recognized that the potential impact of this proposal is large.
The minus point of this proposal is that it introduces the two biggest risks that can be encountered: 1. Insufficient finance will not participate in the DAO and 2. The Cardano ecosystem is not well equipped to support the DAO there. I know that all projects come with certain challenges, especially for an ambitious project like this. However, the proposed team has not foreseen solutions to deal with those risks, so it will worry us about your ability to carry out this project. What if those risks do happen? We need fallback methods to ensure that the project will be successfully implemented by the proposed team.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility of the project is average, for an ambitious proposal like this, I think we need a lot more information to be able to determine the feasibility of the project. The first is about the roadmap, the author briefly introduces the tasks and goals he needs to achieve, then gives us a 5-month roadmap. We know the main tasks for each month, as well as the amount to use in those months. What we need in that roadmap, however, is execution, not results. For example: "Month 1: Designing and developing the standard template and tools: $20000" we know the first month's task is to design and develop the template but who will do it, and how many the person in charge of this role, how many hours are they working, how can I determine if the $20,000 claim is reasonable??? The same goes for the next few months, we need to know more details about the roadmap of this project
Next comes the budget, the $100,000 proposal, and the very superficial explanation. That is, we know that the money will be spent on things like Design, treasury, marketing, and development... it would be better if you broke these costs down into possible small items that can be determined. For example, the marketing cost why is $10,000 what marketing strategy will be used, how to reach the target audience, how long will this process take, and who will implement it?
And finally about the team, right after this proposal is an extremely powerful team in both quantity and quality. However, the information provided is not enough to make a comprehensive assessment of this team, we know their names, their expertise, and affiliation profiles. We need more information on what their role is in this project. Therefore, I think that the feasibility of the proposal is not good, so it is better to develop all topics about the script, team, and budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides two easily measurable KPIs:
-Number of DAO tools deployed
-Number of DAOs included in the chain
And the success of the project is said to be that the more DAOs are managed, the greater the success. As more and more DAOs seek engagement, community engagement and projects have the potential to increase, thus improving and allowing Cardano and the Konma ecosystem to grow. In short, this is what we are capable of testing. It's not bad, but it's superficial, again. I would like a monthly report to be prepared at the end of each cycle of the total time so that we can evaluate how the professionals involved have performed and also the partial results, based on the KPIs provided
f6_assessments.reply:
PA has some understanding of Konma and its products (sub DAOs), but does not see it as an ecosystem. Konma Labz is the R&D wing with Konma Hope and Konma Sprout as launchpads. Konma sprout has started receiving proposals and we will be incubating and selecting 10 ideas by September, which will go on Pitch Ground. The next layer is Konma Flair and Konma Upskill which work with college students or interested members to learn blockchain principles, web3 ideas, and Catalyst. Konma Ambassador and Clique program enables automated sales and marketing. Konma Kernel enables Operations and builds the architecture framework. Konma Moai enables Governance (the Trivergence of Management, Finance, and Law). Konmahood is a community with a community-facing side, and we host Konma United sessions on Wednesdays and is a growing community with close to 300 members now. DAOs are being defined and fine-tuned, and this becomes the framework that can be modified for new DAOs. All products are treated here as sub DAOs and hence the DAO of DAOs usage and our experiment has an MVP (not just an idea), and interest already from collaborators.   
Konma is an ecosystem and will be able to work as a side-chain and be able to reach/engage broader section of people in South Asian region (and also share the frameworks to other global teams as required).

f6_assessments.q0:
Contribute to the migration and provide more information to the community and newcomers to know more about Cardano, the challenge is to develop the DAO in the DAO in the Cardano chain (sub DAO in the main DAO)
Solution: create a standard operation and a template , tools for the DAO to integrate smoothly to accomplish the goal of bringing a wide range of DAPs to the Cardano chain called Komma
Proposal to aim to be an umbrella DAO even with 10 extra knives. So the newly developed DAPs will have a chance and grow.
The risk posed by the project is financial, the ecosystem is not well equipped to support the DAO, this risk affects the survival of the challenge.
If this project grows, it will attract many new and experienced developers who want to migrate to Cardano
f6_assessments.q1:
Timeline with clear goals associated with specific budget allocations. The budget devoted to the development of the smooth integration of the deliverables accounts for 50% of the challenge resolution.
The team consists of Konna managers and consultants with a public profile with attachments, but the specific assignment for members of the team has not been proposed.
There are 2 main tasks in the blueprint:
- Design standard template to introduce DAO, develop tool for smooth integration of DAO
- After the design stage is completed and the goal is reached, 2 DAOs will be introduced every month
The project completion time of 5 months shows that the team has strengths and is knowledgeable about blockchain engineering in general and the Cadano ecosystem in particular.
The proposal itself is a DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) so developing sub-DAOs will not be a problem for the team. I believe you can do it, I agree with the team that the project is very doable.
The development of many DAOs on the Cadano ecosystem will increase the value of Cardano (increase the value of the ADA coin)
f6_assessments.q2:
The goal of broadcasting many sub-DAOs in Konma DAO, the number of connections is put into the chain, the operation of DAOs is smooth because of the number of DAO tools deployed, then these two indicators are a measure of the project.
The DAO is an important part of the blockchain, so the more DAOs are born and developed, the more successful it will increase the value of the Cardano ecosystem.
Many potential projects will choose Cardano to get rid of karma.
The project needs to develop specific KPIs to increase transparency

f6_assessments.q0: DAOs create an all inclusive participation of a diverse collection of people in the governance and ownership of a blockchain as well as other decentralized communities. DAOs allow everyone to participate in a decentralized form of governance and decision making which is made possible by blockchains. These proposer is proposing to build a DAO by leveraging the Cardano blockchain that will house/serve as an umbrella to other DAOs. The project will provide incubation services, dev. support, DAO framework resources, tools and end to end user services for sub DAOs thereby enabling non blockchain organisations and communities to embrace a blockchain based decentralized governance made possible by the Cardano blockchain. These proposal therefore aligns with the challenge criteria.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provides a detailed and well defined timeline with key milestones/KPIs. The timeline provided is on a monthly basis and each month has an expected deliverable. Furthermore, it is expected that the project will have an MVP within the period of 6months.

The budget seems relatively high and not well broken down to my understanding. For example, items like Design:$8k, Development: $8k, Treasury: $40k are all too composite and i therefore find it difficult to understand how those values are arrived at (A proper breakdown of budget items will be more understandable and will ease interpretation). These breakdown will help the entire community understand the plans of implementation and the technical architectural structure of the project. There's a very detailed information about team with verifiable links, roles and expertise.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provided detailed information with decent metrics to measure and track the progress and success of the project. KPIs like number of DAO tools deployed, number of DAOs brought onchain are suitable metrics to measure progress. As for successful implementation, these will or can be seen through how DAO onboarding occurs and how effortless onboarding process is together with how healthy the immediate community is.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea addresses the objectives of the challenge, as it seeks to create sub DAOs that will help onboarding, incubation and development of people into the cardano ecosystem, decentralization is the easers and fasters way interested people have access to the ecosystem . The proposers justify that it is a strategic to put in place for the successful implementation of the project. What could be improved, in my opinion, would be the strategies to overcome the possible risk that may hinder the execution of the project. But overall, the impact of the proposal is high and fits in very well with what is asked here.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers made a very good submissions about the team, apart from their personal primary information, they also provide several links from their social networks, such as linkedin, where we can get to know them more deeply and several direct communication channels, where individual contact can be established with each. that was a good job. A lot of confidence in the authors' ability to successfully execute the project is assured. There is a very detailed script here, in which we know what would happen in phases, divided into months. On the financial split, I think this proposal ideally explains how the money would be used, because they don't just split the total amount, but specify more details about each part. In this way, we have an accurate understanding of how this money would be used. with this information I guess the project is feasible
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the description of the problem, the solution and how the proposal is aligned with them. The roadmap is very well designed, there are deliverables/milestones that make auditing the proposal easier.
The metrics and KPIs were well chosen and I believe they are good indicators for evaluating success, as the chosen outputs would clearly indicate the number of DAOs tools deployed, DAOs brought on the blockchain and the progress report over time.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has effectively addressed the challenge as it seeks to help other DAO to enter the Cardano ecosystem by providing end-to-end services from incubation to deployment unto the chain. This will lead to an increase in the number of DAOs onboarding unto the Cardano ecosystem.
Making the Cardano blockchain a preferred destination for DAOs meets the target in the challenge. In addition, the  proposal is in the right challenge for that matter I gave it a rating of 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team working on the this proposal have the skills and experience necessary to implement it. There are about 10 technical experts as well as 12 advisors working on this project who are all expects in their field.
The plan to develop a standard template for DAOs onboarding unto the Cardano ecosystem as well as developing relevant tools for smooth integration is welcoming idea. Targeting 2 DAOs to onboard every month is an achievable task especially when the skeletal framework of project is done.
The budget accompanying this proposal is also realistic and reasonable.
For this reasons I gave it a 5 star rating
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has detailed a comprehensive timeline with key metrics with which progress and success will be measured.
The proposal projects to have 2 DAOs onboarding the ecosystem every month.
The team plans to share updates and relevant updates on its site so as to help the catalyst community to track progress and success of the project. 
I agree that the information provided in the proposal is sufficient to audit its  progress and success. For that matter I will give it a 5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is for the new entrants who are new to the cardano ecosystem
To spread awareness about the cardano ecosystem, dev support and tools this proposal helps where they can host the DAO's .KonmaDAO would help the new entrants having a blockchain based governance layer to enter the cardao ecosystem by providing them the necessary services from the beginning to the deployment of their DAO on chain .The proposer wants to bring the variety of DAO's onto the Cardano Network. This can only be done by providing them the building tools for easy DAO integration as well as a standard operating method and template for the onboarded DAOs to follow .
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer have provided the detailed plan  including timeline and key milestones for delivering your proposal. Which includes to  design the standard template for DAO onboarding and developing relevant tools for their smooth integration once the structure is formed then to they aim to board two DAO's/Month . The proposal will be executed in the 6 months of time. 
The proposer have provided full clear description of the approach in the proposal.
The proper have mentioned the resources that are needed to implement the proposal .The Budget mentioned by the proposer is reasonable and the timeline is realistic .The proposer have considered the risks and the challenges for successful implementation . The team looks very experienced and have provided the details of their works and the skills needed to implement the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The progress of the proposal can be tracked by examining the Number of DAO tools deployed and by Number of DAOs brought on chain .The proposer target of an initial 2 DAOs a month and subsequent 5 DAOs periodically .
The proposer have mentioned the clear understandable description of the targeted problem and also mentioned solution that addresses the problem .The Proposal have clearly mentioned  metrices/kpi that define the successes of proposal. Upon reviewing the proposal I strongly agree that the proposer have provided enough to assess the progresses in attaining its stated goals.

solution: KonmaDAO would enable organizations having a blockchain based governance layer to enter the ecosystem, while providing end-to-end services; from incubation to deployment of these niche DAOs on chain.
experience: Konma is a decentralized autonomous organization which governs various factions of konma and other partnerships. We plan to make every faction of Konma a sub DAO under the main Konma DAO. We have in house experts for finance, governance and blockchain
